title.value: Survey on Explainable AI: Techniques, challenges and open issues
title.justification: The title is clearly mentioned in the beginning of the paper.
title.quote: Survey on Explainable AI: Techniques, challenges and open issues

extractions.description: This paper classifies and compares the main findings in the domain of explainable machine learning and deep learning, discussing its applications in sensitive domains like cybersecurity. It reviews methods and techniques used for achieving XAI and outlines substantial challenges and future research directions.

type.justification: The paper is described as a survey, indicating it is a comprehensive review of the existing literature and findings in the domain of explainable AI.
type.quote: This paper classifies and compares the main findings in the domain of explainable machine learning and deep learning.

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is on explainable AI, as indicated by the title and the content of the paper.
name.quote: Survey on Explainable AI: Techniques, challenges and open issues

name.justification: The paper explores explainable AI in the context of machine learning applications.
name.quote: Explainable artificial intelligence (XAI) can be seen as a set of procedures and techniques that can be applied and/or integrated to/into machine learning models.

name.justification: The paper discusses deep learning as part of the domain of explainable machine learning.
name.quote: While these advanced models could achieve high accuracy, they are generally unable to explain their decisions (e.g., predictions) to users.

name.justification: Deep Neural Networks (DNNs) are mentioned as being accurate but not interpretable, which is why they are discussed in the context of explainability.
name.quote: On the other hand, deep neural networks (DNNs) are more accurate than traditional machine learning models, but the decisions of DNNs are mostly not interpretable to users.

is_contributed.justification: The paper does not propose a new model but discusses existing models like DNNs.
is_contributed.quote: On the other hand, deep neural networks (DNNs) are more accurate than traditional machine learning models, but the decisions of DNNs are mostly not interpretable to users.

is_executed.justification: The paper is a survey and does not execute models. It discusses them theoretically.
is_executed.quote: This paper classifies and compares the main findings in the domain of explainable machine learning and deep learning.

is_compared.justification: DNNs are compared with other models in terms of accuracy and interpretability.
is_compared.quote: For example, linear models...are excellent in terms of interpretability, but the accuracy of these models is too low...On the other hand, deep neural networks (DNNs) are more accurate.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The comparison between models, including DNNs, cites Arrieta et al., 2020.
referenced_paper_title.quote: For example, linear models...are excellent in terms of interpretability...On the other hand, deep neural networks (DNNs) are more accurate ... (Arrieta et al., 2020).
